description.en: The course is comprised of lectures and seminars in which the fundamental framework, most important methods as well as questions central to the methodology of the study of culture and religion are discussed.  Additionally the students are expected to complete three small home assignments and one larger assignment.
description.et: Aine koosneb loengutest ja seminaridest, milles käsitletakse kultuuri- ja religiooniuurimise metodoloogia ülesehitust, peamisi meetodeid ja keskseid küsimusi. Lisaks teevad üleõpilased kolm väiksemat kodutöö ja ühe suurema kodutöö.

objectives.en: To present an overview of the fundamental framework, most important methods and questions central to the methodology of the study of culture and religion.
objectives.et: Anda ülevaade kultuuri- ja religiooniuurimise metodoloogia ülesehitusest, peamistest meetoditest ja olulisematest küsimustest.

learning_outcomes.en: After the completion of the course the student:
- is basic knowledge about the fundamental methodological framework in the study of culture and religion
learning_outcomes.et: - on kursis religiooni- ja kultuuriuurimise metodoloogia ülesehitusega

learning_outcomes.en: - has acquired elementary skills in the application and the main research methods
learning_outcomes.et: - on omandanud esmased oskused peamiste meetodite rakendamisel

learning_outcomes.en: - comprehends central methodological issues and questions in the study of culture and religion
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab kaasa mõelda kesksete metodoloogiliste küsimustega

learning_outcomes.en: - is capable of arguing in favour of his/her position in a clear and critical manner.

notes.en: The course will be taught individually if there are fewer than three participants.
notes.et: The course will be taught individually if there are fewer than three participants.

description.et:
E - main ideas are of texts understood, presentation vague, analysis lacking.
D - texts are understood quite thoroughly, presentation clear, the connections between analysis and the texts read are weak.
C - texts are understood thoroughly, presentation clear, analysis is based on understanding of the text.
B - texts are understood thoroughly and contextually, presentation clear on both authors positions and personal analysis, arguments one-sided.
A - presentation gives new insights, is well based on thorough and contextual understanding of texts and their contexts, arguments are clear.

E - Content of the text corresponds to the topic, but the theoretical basis is weak and thoughts at times incoherent. Conclusions are not justified. There are inconsistencies in text, some of the text is missing. Format is poor, different reference systems are used and some references are missing.
D - Content of the text corresponds to the topic, but the theoretical basis of the material is uneven, and thoughts at times incoherent. Conclusions are weakly justified There are inconsistencies in text, some of the text is missing. Format is correct, but different reference systems are used.
C - Content of the text corresponds to the topic, relevant theories are outlined, thoughts are understandable and conclusions justified. The structure of the text is logical, at times there are abrupt transitions. Format is correct, and a consistent reference system is used.
B - Content of the text corresponds to the topic, it relies on key theoretical positions, reflects the independent research and contains generalizations. Ideas are presented clearly. The text is complete, the structure is logical. Format is correct, and a consistent reference system is used.
A - Content of the text corresponds to the topic, it is based on the essential and appropriate theoretical positions and reflects the independent research. The text is generalizing, analytical, creative and original, ideas are presented clearly and persuasively. The text is a structured whole, the structure is logical and coherent. Format is correct and a consistent reference system is used.

grade_preconditions.et:
1) Active participation in at least 80% of the lectures and seminars. 
2) Submission of three small individual assignments.
3) Submission of the research assignment and its presentation in seminar.

grade_evaluation.et:
Research assignment and its presentation - 55%
Each small individual assignment - 15% (for a total of 45%).

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
